title: Implement Global Multi-Language System with 9 Languages

requirements.summary: Create LanguageSelector component with dropdown for 9 supported languages
acceptanceCriteria: LanguageSelector component renders in Header component
Dropdown displays all 9 languages with proper labels
Current language is highlighted
Mobile responsive with touch-friendly tap targets
Smooth open/close animations

file_operations.description: Create LanguageSelector component that renders a dropdown button displaying current language with flag icon or language code (e.g., 'EN', 'हिं', 'বাং'). On click, show dropdown menu with all 9 languages: English (en), Hindi (hi), Bengali (bn), Tamil (ta), Telugu (te), Marathi (mr), Gujarati (gu), Kannada (kn), Malayalam (ml), Urdu (ur). Highlight currently selected language. Use shadcn/ui DropdownMenu component for accessibility. Include smooth animations for dropdown open/close. Ensure touch-friendly tap targets (min 44px) for mobile. Call setLanguage from useLanguage hook when user selects a language.

requirements.summary: Create i18n infrastructure with LanguageContext provider
acceptanceCriteria: LanguageContext provides currentLanguage state
setLanguage function updates language without page reload
Language preference persists in localStorage
useLanguage hook accessible in all components
Context wrapped around App in main.tsx

file_operations.description: Create LanguageContext and LanguageProvider that manages currentLanguage state (default 'en'), translations object, and loading state. Provide setLanguage function that updates state, persists to localStorage key 'documentmaster_language', and dynamically imports the new language JSON file. Provide translate function (t) that accepts a translation key string and returns the translated value from the loaded translations object. Export useLanguage hook that returns { currentLanguage, setLanguage, t, isLoading }. Initialize language from localStorage or default to 'en'. Handle missing translation keys by returning the key itself as fallback.

Wrap the entire Router component with LanguageProvider from frontend/src/contexts/LanguageContext.tsx. Place LanguageProvider inside QueryClientProvider and ThemeProvider but outside BrowserRouter. This ensures language context is available to all routed components.

requirements.summary: Update App.tsx routing to support language-prefixed URLs
acceptanceCriteria: Routes support optional /:lang prefix
Language code in URL sets active language automatically
Default routes without prefix use English
Navigation preserves current language in URLs
All existing routes work with language prefixes

file_operations.description: Update React Router routes to support optional /:lang parameter. For each existing route, add a duplicate route with /:lang prefix (e.g., both '/calculators' and '/:lang/calculators'). Create a wrapper component or useEffect in App.tsx that reads the :lang param from useParams(), validates it against supported languages (en|hi|bn|ta|te|mr|gu|kn|ml|ur), and calls setLanguage from useLanguage hook to update active language. If :lang param is invalid or missing, default to 'en'. Ensure all existing routes continue to work without language prefix.

Update navigation links in Header component to include current language prefix in URLs. Use currentLanguage from useLanguage hook. Update Link components to prepend `/${currentLanguage}` to existing paths (e.g., `/${currentLanguage}/calculators`). For default English, use paths without prefix (e.g., '/calculators'). Ensure logo link also preserves current language.

Update footer navigation links to include current language prefix in URLs. Use currentLanguage from useLanguage hook. Update Link components for quick links (calculators, PDF tools, image tools, resume builder) and legal links (privacy, terms, disclaimer) to prepend `/${currentLanguage}` to paths when language is not 'en'. Preserve footer copyright text unchanged.

requirements.summary: Update SEO component to render hreflang link tags for all languages
acceptanceCriteria: hreflang tags generated for all 9 languages on every page
x-default hreflang points to English version

file_operations.description: Modify SEO component to accept currentLanguage and currentPath props. Generate hreflang link tags for all 9 supported languages (en, hi, bn, ta, te, mr, gu, kn, ml, ur) pointing to language-specific URL variants constructed from currentPath. Add x-default hreflang pointing to English URL (no language prefix). Update canonical link tag to reflect current language URL. Use Helmet or document.head to inject hreflang tags into <head>. Construct language URLs following pattern: base URL + '/' + lang code + currentPath (e.g., 'https://docmastertools.com/hi/calculators/age-calculator').

requirements.summary: Implement lazy loading for translation files with loading states
acceptanceCriteria: Translation files loaded on-demand via dynamic import()
Loading indicator shown during language switch
Translations cached after first load
Error handling for network failures
No full page reload on language change

file_operations.description: Update LanguageContext to implement lazy loading of translation JSON files. Use dynamic import() to load language files only when setLanguage is called: `const translations = await import(`./locales/${lang}.json`)`. Maintain a cache object to store loaded translations and avoid re-fetching. Set isLoading state to true during import, false after completion. Add error handling for failed imports with try-catch block and fallback to English translations on error. Show error toast notification on load failure. Ensure no page reload occurs during language switch.

acceptanceCriteria: SEO component accepts language prop

Twitter Card tags use current language

file_operations.description: Modify SEO component to accept language parameter and use translated meta titles and descriptions. Import useLanguage hook to access t() function. Update title, description, og:title, og:description, twitter:title, and twitter:description meta tags to use translation keys passed as props (e.g., t(titleKey)). Ensure language-specific canonical URLs are constructed. Preserve existing Open Graph, Twitter Card, and structured data functionality.

requirements.summary: Implement browser language auto-detection on initial page load
acceptanceCriteria: Browser language detected on first visit
Language code mapped to supported languages
Falls back to English for unsupported languages
Optional redirect to detected language URL
User preference in localStorage overrides detection
Detection only runs once per session

file_operations.description: Add browser language auto-detection logic in LanguageProvider initialization. Check if language preference exists in localStorage first. If not, read navigator.language or navigator.languages[0], extract language code (first 2 characters), and map to supported languages (en, hi, bn, ta, te, mr, gu, kn, ml, ur). Fall back to 'en' for unsupported languages. Optionally use useNavigate to redirect to detected language URL if different from current URL (check window.location.pathname). Set a session flag in sessionStorage to prevent re-detection on subsequent page navigations within the same session.

requirements.summary: Update sitemap.xml generation to include language-specific URLs for all pages

file_operations.description: Create sitemap generation utility that programmatically generates sitemap.xml with language-specific URLs for all 9 languages (en, hi, bn, ta, te, mr, gu, kn, ml, ur). For each page (calculators, PDF tools, image tools, resume builder templates, hub pages, legal pages), generate 9 URL variants following pattern: base URL + '/' + language code + page path (e.g., 'https://docmastertools.com/hi/calculators/cgpa-calculator'). For English, generate URLs both with and without '/en' prefix for backward compatibility. Preserve existing priority and changefreq values based on page type (e.g., priority 0.9 for calculator pages, 0.8 for tools). Output as valid XML sitemap format. This utility should be run during build process to generate frontend/public/sitemap.xml.

Replace existing sitemap.xml content with generated sitemap containing all language-specific URLs. Include URL entries for all 9 languages for every page: all 20+ calculator pages, 16 PDF tool pages, 8+ image tool pages, 14 resume templates, hub pages (calculators, PDF tools, image tools, resume builder), legal pages (privacy, terms, disclaimer), and homepage. For English pages, include both versioned (/en/path) and non-versioned (/path) URLs. Maintain proper XML structure with <urlset>, <url>, <loc>, <lastmod>, <changefreq>, and <priority> tags for each entry.
